intro: Mesembryanthemum wordsworthiae, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in summer, producing bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its adaptability and ornamental value have contributed to its cultivation in various regions with similar climates.
